articles.headline: Discounted Cars Benefit Buyers, but May Spell Trouble for Industry
articles.snippet: Hefty price cuts are the latest signs of difficulty in the auto industry, which faces declining sales.
articles.abstract: Hefty price cuts are the latest signs of difficulty in the auto industry, which faces declining sales.
articles.lead_paragraph: Big cash discounts are making a comeback in the car business.

articles.headline: Trump Shifts Rationale for Firing Comey, Calling Him a ‘Showboat’
articles.snippet: In an NBC interview, the president said he would have dismissed the F.B.I. director even if the attorney general and his deputy had not advised it.
articles.abstract: In an NBC interview, the president said he would have dismissed the F.B.I. director even if the attorney general and his deputy had not advised it.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump offered a new version of his decision to fire James B. Comey, saying on Thursday that he would have dismissed the F.B.I. director regardless of whether the attorney general and his deputy recommended it.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Acting F.B.I. Chief Contradicts White House on Russia and Comey
articles.snippet: The acting director called the Russia investigation “highly significant” and said the fired F.B.I. chief had “broad support” from employees, rebutting White House claims.
articles.abstract: The acting director called the Russia investigation “highly significant” and said the fired F.B.I. chief had “broad support” from employees, rebutting White House claims.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The acting director of the F.B.I. contradicted the White House on two major issues on Thursday: the support of rank-and-file agents for the fired F.B.I. chief James B. Comey and the importance of the agency’s investigation into Russian election interference.
articles.byline: By Adam Goldman and Matthew Rosenberg

articles.headline: In Snap Inc.’s Tumble, Start-Ups See a Warning From Wall Street
articles.snippet: Snap’s turbulent first few months as a public company are sending a cautionary signal to start-up founders thinking of taking their companies public.
articles.abstract: Snap’s turbulent first few months as a public company are sending a cautionary signal to start-up founders thinking of taking their companies public.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A day after Snap posted a $2.2 billion loss and decelerating user growth in its first earnings report as a public company, the repercussions started spreading through the technology start-up ecosystem.

articles.headline: In a Private Dinner, Trump Demanded Loyalty. Comey Demurred.
articles.snippet: James B. Comey’s associates say he now believes his unwillingness to pledge personal loyalty led President Trump to fire him as the F.B.I. director.
articles.abstract: James B. Comey’s associates say he now believes his unwillingness to pledge personal loyalty led President Trump to fire him as the F.B.I. director.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Only seven days after Donald J. Trump was sworn in as president, James B. Comey has told associates, the F.B.I. director was summoned to the White House for a one-on-one dinner with the new commander in chief.

articles.headline: Barclays’s Latest Problem: Questions on Chief’s Judgment
articles.snippet: James E. Staley has brought vitality to the troubled bank, but two episodes have given rise to shareholder protests and multiple investigations.
articles.abstract: James E. Staley has brought vitality to the troubled bank, but two episodes have given rise to shareholder protests and multiple investigations.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s often said that the most important qualities in a chief executive are character and judgment. So what are shareholders, directors, customers and the public to make of the Barclays chief executive, James E. Staley, the subject of shareholder protests and multiple investigations on both sides of the Atlantic after little more than a year in the executive suite?

articles.headline: Singapore, a Rising Home for Quiet Money, Comes Under Pressure
articles.snippet: The wealth holdings in the city-state are rising as Switzerland shares more banking information, but scandals have prompted a crackdown.
articles.abstract: The wealth holdings in the city-state are rising as Switzerland shares more banking information, but scandals have prompted a crackdown.
articles.lead_paragraph: SINGAPORE — Last year, American law enforcement officials pressed the Swiss bank UBS about Henry Hsiaw, a Taiwan-born American whom they accused of failing to file tax returns.

articles.headline: This Year’s College-Bound Essayists and Their ‘Beautiful Contradictions’
articles.snippet: College admissions directors weigh in on the teenagers whose college application essays about money, work and social class rose above the crowd.
articles.abstract: College admissions directors weigh in on the teenagers whose college application essays about money, work and social class rose above the crowd.
articles.lead_paragraph: The innkeepers and the guests. The owners and the housekeepers. The urban and the rural. The studious and the watchers of cat videos. And finally (and memorably), Mac versus Dell.

articles.headline: Trump Warning to Comey Prompts Questions on ‘Tapes’
articles.snippet: “James Comey better hope that there are no ‘tapes’ of our conversations before he starts leaking to the press!” Mr. Trump posted on Twitter.
articles.abstract: “James Comey better hope that there are no ‘tapes’ of our conversations before he starts leaking to the press!” Mr. Trump posted on Twitter.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump on Friday warned James B. Comey, the F.B.I. director whom he fired this week, against leaking anything negative about him, saying that Mr. Comey “better hope” that there are no secret tapes of their conversations that the president could use in retaliation.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Venezuela Tries Protesters in Military Court ‘Like We Are in a War’
articles.snippet: President Nicolás Maduro has turned to the military to tighten his grip, prosecuting demonstrators and other civilians in tribunals the government controls.
articles.abstract: President Nicolás Maduro has turned to the military to tighten his grip, prosecuting demonstrators and other civilians in tribunals the government controls.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOGOTÁ, Colombia — Cheers erupted as the protesters toppled the statue of former President Hugo Chávez, the metal cracking against concrete. The scenes, distributed around Venezuela on social media, showed a crowd smashing the sculpture on a curbside as others came to set a fire inside its shattered belly.

articles.headline: How North Korea Managed to Defy Years of Sanctions
articles.snippet: Chinese reluctance, legal loopholes and thousands of laborers sent abroad have sustained Pyongyang’s economy in the face of often-painful restrictions.
articles.abstract: Chinese reluctance, legal loopholes and thousands of laborers sent abroad have sustained Pyongyang’s economy in the face of often-painful restrictions.
articles.lead_paragraph: DANDONG, China — As the end of the fashion season approached, and the suits and dresses arrived in her company’s warehouses here in the Chinese border town of Dandong, the accountant crammed about $100,000 into a backpack, then boarded a rickety train with several co-workers.
articles.byline: By Jane Perlez, Yufan Huang and Paul Mozur

articles.headline: Uber Has a Union of Sorts, but Faces Doubts on Its Autonomy
articles.snippet: A group tied to the Machinists has won victories in the name of the service’s drivers. But it is funded by the company, and some question its motives.
articles.abstract: A group tied to the Machinists has won victories in the name of the service’s drivers. But it is funded by the company, and some question its motives.
articles.lead_paragraph: Uber was a pioneer in seamlessly connecting passengers and drivers through an app. Now a union-led group meant to represent its drivers is also taking an unorthodox approach — as well as Uber’s money.

articles.headline: Trump Tax Plan Will Not Bolster Growth, Economists Say
articles.snippet: A wide range of economists see little chance for proposed tax cuts to increase economic growth over the next few years.
articles.abstract: A wide range of economists see little chance for proposed tax cuts to increase economic growth over the next few years.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump says the perfect medicine for the economy’s sluggish growth is a big tax cut.

articles.headline: Hackers Hit Dozens of Countries Exploiting Stolen N.S.A. Tool
articles.snippet: The attacks amounted to an audacious global blackmail attempt spread by the internet, and underscored the vulnerabilities of the digital age.
articles.abstract: The attacks amounted to an audacious global blackmail attempt spread by the internet, and underscored the vulnerabilities of the digital age.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Hackers exploiting malicious software stolen from the National Security Agency executed damaging cyberattacks on Friday that hit dozens of countries worldwide, forcing Britain’s public health system to send patients away, freezing computers at Russia’s Interior Ministry and wreaking havoc on tens of thousands of computers elsewhere.
articles.byline: By Nicole Perlroth and David E. Sanger
